Case Study

Avira Antivirus - Desktop App - Redesign

Project Overview

Avira Antivirus Free and Pro are the main and most sold product of Avira portfolio. It has a history of more than 25 years protecting people in a connected world.

2 years ago, the UI of the Antivirus got a new look and feel and was connected to the Avira Connect which is the central platform for all Avira services and products.

The Antivirus UI helps users to manage all protection layers in order to keep safe the computer against threats from the internet.

My role

Product Designer

Methods and Tools

Interview, Competitive Analysis, Adobe XD,

Practices

Design System, Product Thinking, Interaction design, Visual Design, User research, UX & UI Design, Prototyping

Challenge

In these years, even if we have updated the UI, many usability challenges arrived to us:

  • Free users don’t understand the potential of paid protection layers of the Avira Antivirus.
  • We have outdated parts (Scans, configuration) which are not upgraded to the new design concept yet.
  • Users feel frustrated because they don’t fully understand the main purpose (wording, icons,…) of the main view in the Avira Antivirus.

Task

  • Download “Avira Antivirus Free” from Avira web site and you will find also some examples in the next page.
  • Rethink and Revamp the Free main user interface such that
    • Since Avira Antivirus is a Free product, provide a most optimal design to lure customers into upgrading to pro version (e.g. “Avira Prime”)
    • Integrate a vision about how the “Quick scan” scanner should be redesigned and integrated in the main UI.
    • Create a perception of the main view where customers have a better understanding about the Antivirus status and management, improving the user experience.
  • Provide a “sample only” design guide that could be used by developer and present your results on the onsite event to a selected team.

Process

Discover, Define, Design and Deliver
I followed HCD process by first conducting user research. After synthesizing inspiring insights from survey and interviews, I defined the problem and jumped right into the ideation phase. From sketches all the way into fidelity prototypes, I gradually created the first version of the application. I also conducted in-house usability testings and iterated more based on the feedback I received.

Discovery

While doing ‘Expert Review’ of Avira Free Antivirus Desktop application (MAC), I’ve found several issues on each screen and updated the same on the slides. There are several other issues which I’ve not included in these slide.

After reviewing the Application, I’ve found that there is an urgent need of Pattern Library and Styleguide, for making the Consistent and smooth experience to users. Few of key improvement areas are listed below.

  • Accessibility issues.
    The application should be able to use without a mouse. Currently, the app is not being able to operate via Keyboard only
  • UI Consistency issues
    The current Application lacks on lots of area on consistency.
  • Iconography is not consistent
    Icons are used from different icon style. It should be consistent
  • Many more UX issues
    • Users are not getting any confirmation message on critical tasks.
    • Warnings and errors are not clearly differentiable.
    • Inappropriate use of Color.
    • UI is not consistent
    • Button states design and position are not correct.
    • Lacks on Interaction design (IXD)

Ideation

Understanding the Product
I conducted the competetive analysis to study how other products takle the similar problems. I picked 6 competive products to compare the overall UI and flows and 5 well established design system to learn how to effectively deliver the product.

Wireframe

Pattern library

Visual design
